text: Amazon Simple Queue Service (Amazon SQS) Amazon Simple Queue Service (Amazon SQS) is a message queuing service. Using Amazon SQS, you can send, store, and receive messages between software components, without losing messages or requiring other services to be available. In Amazon SQS, an application sends messages into a queue. A user or service retrieves a message from the queue, processes it, and then deletes it from the queue. To review two examples of how to use Amazon SQS, choose the arrow buttons to display each one.
